intro: Ornithocephalus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered ornithocephalus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ornithocephalus multiflorus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
